thread.title: Brian K Vaughan's comic Y: The Last Man is being adapted for television - Comics
thread.title_full: Brian K Vaughan's comic Y: The Last Man is being adapted for television - Comics News - Digital Spy

author: Tasha Hegarty
title: Brian K Vaughan's comic Y: The Last Man is being adapted for television - Comics
text: Brian K Vaughan's Y: The Last Man is being adapted for television with FX.A film adaptation of the comic book series had been in the works for years, but it seems the TV series has been given the go-ahead instead, according to The Hollywood Reporter. Â© Vertigo / DC The comic series was launched in 2002 and revolves around Yorick Brown, the last surviving human with a Y chromosome, and his Capuchin monkey Ampersand. It follows Yorick as he sets out to discover what might have wiped out the world's male chromosomes.Y: The Last Man was written and created by Vaughan and artist Pia Guerra, and ran for 60 editions.FX are teaming with Vaughan and Colour Force's Nina Jacobson and Brad Simpson to develop the dystopian sci-fi comic, and are now searching for a writer and director to take on the project.
